chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shana Lee Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim R.W. (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by agent. May not reside with mother and will communication with mother up to the agent. Pay outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant Shana Lee Smith in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant Shana Lee Smith in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue

15CF1409: count 2 & count 3- Guilty
15CF1694: count 3, count 4 & count 5- Guilty
Rights Given

BTC: 
15CF1409: count 2 & count 3- GUILTY; DRI the balance 
15CF1694: count 3, count 4 & count 5- GUILTY; DRI the balance.

15CF1409
Ct 2- 4 years WPS, 2 years init, 2 years es, i/s, 3 years probation, concurrent to count 3 & concurrent to 15CF1694

Ct 3- 9 months RCJ $100 domestic violence assessment 

15CF1694
Ct 3-  9 months RCJ - can be suspended upon a transfer into residential treatment including HALO & Women of Worth

Ct 4- 4 years WPS, 2 years init, 2 years es, i/s, 3 years probation current to count 3 & count 5, DNA Surcharge

Ct 5- 4 years WPS, 2 years init, 2 years es, i/s, 3 years probation concurrent to ct 3 & 4

15CF619
Ct 2- 4 years WPS, 2 years init, 2 years es, i/s, 3 years probation

Ct 3- 9 months RCJ, to run concurrent with 15CF1409 & 15CF1694 - eligible for expungement in 15CF619

Conditions:
AODA assessment
Counseling 
No contact with R.W. unless approved by agent
May not reside with Mother and will leave communication with mother up to agent
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge on ct 4 in 15CF1694 only

Pay outstanding ZCI fees
FAW
VOTE

Defendant Shana Lee Smith in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant Shana Lee Smith in custody.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- A global offer was extended. Request a COP and sentencing date.
Def- Correct statement. Request the PSI be waived on the new files.
St- No objection.
BTC: PSI waived on new files. Set all files for pleas.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Atty Scheidegger

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with the victim, CS (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

09/08/15 - BOND MODIFIED TO REMOVE SCRAM. Comply with treatment program. Take all meds as prescribed.
